meanings.definition: An underground conduit for carrying off drainage water and waste matter.
meanings.sent1: The sewer beneath the city helps keep the streets dry.
meanings.sent2: The sewer system in our neighborhood is well-maintained.
meanings.sent3: Why did the watermelon refuse to play hide and seek in the sewer? It didn't want to get wet!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sewer, filled with thoughts flowing in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the sewer was so strong, it lingered in the air for hours.

meanings.sent1: My grandmother is a talented sewer and can create beautiful dresses.
meanings.sent2: The local theater hired a professional sewer to make costumes for the actors.
meanings.sent3: Why did the needle refuse to work with the sewer? It was afraid of getting pricked!
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like a skilled sewer, stitching fabric with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sewer's hands danced across the cloth, turning it into a work of art.
